channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Staff are amazed by two diamond necklaces owned by very different clients, but Patrick suspects one of them could be fake upon closer inspection.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Reformed cat burglar Sid hopes to raise funds with help from his family and their jewellery, Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou gets the fright of his life when he test-drives a superbike at Brands Hatch race track, and new employee Kristen faces a challenge when she has to value two huge tanzanite stones. Office manager Jo visits Maggie, a client who can't pay back her loan following a string of bad luck. She's in danger of losing her late mother's jewellery - unless Jo can talk round shrewd businessman James.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer guide artist Zena Ellis as she takes her first step on to the housing ladder in Luton with a budget of £125,000. Also seeking assistance are new parents Lysan and Bo Cheng, who want to move out of London and return to Bedfordshire for a slower-paced family life, but find £550,000 doesn't go far in their chosen part of the country.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is the New Inn, Talgarth, where ex-naval officer Damon Lewis is the sole captain of his ship. Wayne and Marc are determined to be brutally honest, and Donna and David are forced to work closely with their rivals Fay and Ray during an afternoon team-building exercise. Over dinner, Damon admits that taking on the B&B, pub and restaurant all by himself may have not been the best decision - as proved when he has trouble running a solo breakfast service.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Health-conscious grandmother Tina Ainsworth hosts the first dinner party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, putting on a Chinese-themed evening for her guests - croupier Tomasz Wisniewski, PR consultant Julia Smith, copy writer Rachel Imms and DJ Gareth Harding.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Croupier Tomasz Wisniewski hosts the second dinner party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire. His `outrageous'-themed evening leaves plenty of scope for his guests' imaginations, but his balloon-pumping competition brings out the competitive streak in one contestant.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Gareth Harding hosts the third dinner party from Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, where he provides an Ibiza-themed night after he transforms his garden into a Balearic cocktail bar and club complete with lasers and disco lights. The guests seem impressed with the host's sophisticated menu, but he may have bitten off more than he can chew as he attempts to cook a tricky beef Wellington.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Animal lover Rachel Imms hosts the fourth party of the week from Mansfield. She opts for a French-themed evening, but her complicated main course proves to be a challenge, and her accordionist entertainer does not appeal to everyone in the way she had hoped.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance fanatic Julia Smith hosts the final party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, and is confident she will wow fellow competitors with her fancy house and hospitality, having roped in two waiters to give the evening a touch of class. A spot of salsa dancing proves entertaining for all the wrong reasons, and as the event draws to a close, the contestants gather to discover which dinner was rated the best.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps firefighter James find a two-bedroom Victorian conversion in south-west London on an £180,000 budget. In the same location, Phil Spencer looks for a spacious property suitable for Steve and Eloise and their baby twin daughters, but needs to persuade the pair to compromise on the area if they are to find anything within their £330,000 limit.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps teachers Paul Gardner and Paula McKee hunt for the perfect property near Murcia, Spain, after the soon-to-be-wed pair both secured jobs at the nearby international school. The couple have set aside a budget of £200,000 for the relocation.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: Clemency Green, Ant Anstead and Robin Johnson offer advice and Ideas for home furnishings and decor. The first episode explores a Cuban theme while reviving an unloved dining room. Clem and Robin make a woven bench, Ant tries his hand at painting tiles while Robin tries his patience when he makes a beaded chandelier.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: With numbers in the wild dwindling rapidly, Chester Zoo's black rhino breeding programme is a key part of preserving the species. In this episode, black rhino Kitani is introduced to new mate Magadi, but with injury a high risk during mating, keeper Babs is concerned that Kitani may struggle to defend herself, since she lost her horn after the death of her calf. Meanwhile, there's a surprise birth in the orangutan house, and older sibling Tuti has to fend for herself and set out on the road to independence.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The return of the programme following the emergency services, this time focusing on the work of the police, paramedics and fire service in Wiltshire. The first edition examines the rise in racially aggravated hate crimes, with the mother of a nine-year-old girl calling 999 to report that her daughter has been racially abused by two 11-year-olds while out playing. PC James Isaac arrests a 29-year-old man who targeted a 17-year-old white girl with text messages after coming across photos of her and her black boyfriend on Facebook.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 24-year-old beautician Gemma from West Sussex. She has dated a few love rats and is now searching for her Prince Charming. She is followed by 28-year-old bisexual tattoo artist Jennafer, who is fed up of men and now wants to find the perfect woman. Will any of the contestants be just what Jennafer is looking for?.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Divorcee Jane wants to find a suitable partner for her son Bobby, and also a new romantic interest for herself, while maths teacher Paul's love of logic and equations is lost on financial advisor Sophie. Barber Lee has suffered from nerves all of his life and can't believe his luck when he's matched with 24-year-old nurse Abigail, but he forgets her name and has an unfortunate accident in the toilets.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Brothel
programme.desc: Documentary charting the day-to-day workings of a Sheffield massage parlour run by a mother and daughter, revealing the struggle to fill the daily rota and how management deal with problem clients. The programme also explores the lives of the women who advertise their services and for whom sex is just a job.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of specialist letting agencies dealing with benefit tenants who have turned to private landlords. In Leeds, letting agent Aimee has received complaints about a bad smell and a high volume of bluebottles coming from one of her properties. For South Yorkshire agents Andrew and Allen, rent arrears have reached an all-time high, forcing them to come up with a controversial way to bring in more money.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and hilarious take on The Crystal Maze Celebrity Special, The Great Pottery Throw Down and classic movie The Jungle Book.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: Kate and Wills visit Charles's traditionalist new town, Poundbury in Dorset, where Charles is unveiling another statue of himself. Pippa ponders whether she should leave her fiance Johnny, after she learns that he has lost his fortune and has become a pizza delivery man. Meanwhile, Kate runs into old flame Gypsy Ricky, who reminds her they are still married following a traditional gypsy ritual. Will Camilla use this to destroy Kate in her latest plan to grab power? Starring Harry Enfield, Louise Ford and Hugh Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, boss Dan Hatfield and his sister Cherise try to negotiate a deal on a tuk-tuk, and cobbler Peter is looking for a quick cash deal on some designer shoes and an antique clock. Meanwhile, at Pickwick pawnbrokers in London, Nathan Finch secures deals on a classic silver Clipper caravan, some war memorabilia and several designer luxury bags.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou has his work cut out sealing a deal with a pushy young entrepreneur who wants to borrow £100,000 against his Lamborghini, while there's a shock in store for film director Ken Russell's ex-wife Hetty when she brings in a collection of family photographs. A married couple become emotional as they look to pawn a large painting, a mum-of-three parts with her mother's diamond ring to support her kids, and long-term client Tauren risks losing his prized set of designer watches by falling behind on his loan repayments.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Former model Cathy brings in her collection of designer bags and jewellery, hoping to secure a £50,000 loan to help her launch a lingerie business, while Prestige boss James Constantinou attracts unwanted attention when he goes for a spin in a client's Ferrari. A woman wants to pawn her grandfather's First World War medals to raise money for her mother's funeral, and an inventor decides to part with his precious watch.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp tries to find a peaceful North Yorkshire home for Susanna and Phil, an unconventional couple with a complementary health therapy business. Also in the region, Phil Spencer helps Trudie and Steve and their two sons, who are relocating from Edinburgh to be nearer their relatives.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time, with Fay and Ray from Shiralee B&B wanting to find out why David and Donna were so critical of their cleanliness. The group members continue to air their grievances as they find out what they've been paid, before the winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hunting enthusiast Hunni Hindley hosts the first party in Lincoln, basing it on a murder-mystery theme and concocting an unconventional menu in the hope of landing the £1,000 prize. There is a heated debate on hunting, and the other guests provide interesting discourse including Ricky Summers-Calvert, who has a revelation to make about his acting career.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Medical supplier Caroline Bevis hosts the second dinner party in Lincoln, hoping her Roaring Twenties-themed evening, including black-bottom Betty torte with beetroot ice-cream, will secure her the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Insurance underwriter Glenn Priestly hosts the third dinner party from Lincoln, and hopes his theme of rock music legends will win over his guests. However, the tone of the evening is lowered by student Richard Summers-Calvert's inappropriate questions.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bodybuilding drama student Richard Summers-Calvert hosts the fourth party of the week from Lincoln. He serves chicken and rice for his starter, main and dessert, but with a few twists, and entertains his guests with a game of charades after asking them to dress up as action heroes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: All-American mother and former barrister Natashka Ingham hosts the final dinner party from Lincolnshire, and hopes to impress her guests with a theme of The Great American Dream. Her dishes include `fall off your horse black bottom pie' and `cow tail pie' and, despite the fact conversation turns to underpants and toilets, she hopes to have done enough to win the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit a Norwich couple who were worried about stepping on to the property ladder after being dissuaded by surveys. The property gurus also check on the progress of an extended family from Sutton Coldfield who wanted one big house, but could not agree where to live.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman shows a number of properties to newly engaged Glasgow couple Lyndsey and Paul, who want to buy a holiday home in the area around Oliva in eastern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples house-hunting in north-west London. Meanwhile, Amy and Takbir are desperate to get on the first rung of the ladder, but despite some military-style planning, have had no success in the competitive market.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The best and funniest moments from the recent series, including armchair TV reviews of Culinary Genius, Britain's Got Talent, Line of Duty, Cruising with Jane McDonald, University Challenge and First Dates. Plus, news reports featuring Diane Abbott, squirrels and young children gate-crashing a serious interview.(n)

programme.desc: Daniel and Lacy Barrett's relatively peaceful existence is disturbed when strange things begin to happen around their suburban home. As the situation escalates, the couple become convinced they are being tormented by alien visitors, but when they get in touch with an expert in extraterrestrial activity, they realise their ordeal has only just begun. Sci-fi horror, starring Keri Russell and Josh Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: In this hip reboot of the comic-book franchise, a brilliant scientist builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past(n)

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: A biography of Scottish playwright J.M. Barrie, whose relationship with a young widow and her sons inspired the children's classic "Peter Pan."(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: Fast-paced apocalyptic adventure. In a hostile post-World War III world, petrol is the most precious commodity and people will do anything to get it. Embittered lone warrior Max agrees to help when an oil-producing community comes under attack from a violent gang determined to get its hands on their fuel(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: Mel Brooks parodies the films of Alfred Hitchcock -- particularly Vertigo - with High Anxiety, in which the comedian plays Richard Thorndyke, a psychiatrist with a fear of heights who discovers a plot to drive wealthy patients crazy(n)

programme.title: Ghost World
programme.desc: Filmmaker Terry Zwigoff, who enjoyed breakthrough success with his 1994 documentary Crumb, shifts gears as he examines the lives of two young women on the verge of leaving their adolescence behind in his first dramatic feature. Enid (Thora Birch) and Rebecca (Scarlett Johansson) are two close friends who've just graduated from high school, and are trying to decide what to do with their lives. Enid is a dark-haired arch cynic who is tired of living at home with her ineffectual dad (Bob Balaban) and his annoyingly perky girlfriend Maxine (Teri Garr), while Rebecca is prettier and a bit cheerier, but no more certain about her future. While the two girls have vague plans of getting an apartment together, they seem content to while away their summer hanging out and indulging in their shared infatuation with Josh (Brad Renfro), a friend from school who works at a convenience store and doesn't seem to be especially attracted to either of them. Enid discovers that in order to get her diploma, she'll have to take an additional class over the summer, where she winds up studying art with Roberta (Illeana Douglas), who is determined to encourage Enid's creative impulses, whether Enid likes it or not. More significantly, Enid meets Seymour (Steve Buscemi), a geeky record collector more than twice her age, and while they would seem to have little in common (and Rebecca thinks he's a creep), Enid discovers a kindred spirit in fellow misfit Seymour, who shares her disgust with the world around them, and a relationship begins to develop between the two. Ghost World is based on the award-winning graphic novel by comic artist Daniel Clowes, who also wrote the film's screenplay(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, a young girl with asthma is kidnapped and held for ransom, but her captors tell her parents that they'll deprive the child of her medication unless they comply with their terms, one of which is not to contact the police(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer and her writer husband take a cross-country journey to a small coastal town where they bond with its quirky but wise inhabitants(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: A very funny remake of Ernst Lubitsch's classic 1942 black comedy about actors who turn spies in World War II Warsaw. A theatre troupe are unwittingly embroiled in the Polish Resistance via a young freedom fighter who is carrying on an affair with the leading lady(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: After getting arrested, drinks salesmen Danny and Wheeler are forced to mentor two troubled kids. But who's learning from whom?(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Four women with vastly different ideas about love and relationships navigate the single life of New York City. Taking a break from her long-term boyfriend Josh (Nicholas Braun), Alice (Dakota Johnson) sets out on a journey of self-discovery with her hard-drinking new friend Robin (Rebel Wilson). Meanwhile, Alice's career-driven older sister Meg (Leslie Mann) struggles with the idea of settling down, and uptight romantic Lucy (Alison Brie) searches for her perfect match. Adapted from former Sex and the City writer Liz Tuccillo's debut novel, this modern rom com was directed by Christian Ditter(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Comic jewels Tina Fey and Amy Poehler, who once shared the "Saturday Night Live" stage, reunite in this outrageous romp. Fey's a buttoned-down career woman who agrees to let loopy working-class girl Poehler become the surrogate mother of her child. Steve Martin costars as Fey's New Age health-food entrepreneur boss, and Sigourney Weaver is hilarious as a smug director of the surrogacy agency. Written and directed by Michael McCullers, former writer at "SNL."(n)

programme.title: Bachelor Party
programme.desc: Bawdy comic tale about a happy-go-lucky school bus driver who falls for a wealthy woman and decides to marry her, despite the disapproval of her snobbish parents. The night before the wedding, he and his friends decide to hold the stag party to end all stag parties, while his fiancee and her friends plan to spy on them. Meanwhile, her parents try to find a way of luring their daughter away from her unsuitable fiance(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Male supermodel Derek Zoolander is on his way down after three years of continuously winning the "Male Model of the Year" award. When he is beaten by the hot newcomer Hansel, Derek starts searching for a new meaning in his life. Just then fashion czar Mugatu offers Derek a comeback in his new "Derelicte"-line. What nobody suspected is that Mugatu plans to assassinate the new Malaysian Prime Minister on his visit to New York, so that cheap child labour is still available for Mugatu's fashion producing. By brainwashing Zoolander, Mugatu and his evil associate Katinka create a dumb and willing killer to do the job. Only in Time Magazine journalist Matilda suspicion arises slowly, and she tries to stop Derek(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Edward Norton and Ben Stiller are delightful in Norton's directorial debut about a priest and a rabbi who've been friends since childhood. But when another old pal (Jenna Elfman) reunites with the men, one of them is in danger of becoming a third wheel. Eli Wallach, Anne Bancroft, Ron Rifkin, Milos Forman(n)

programme.title: All the President's Men
programme.desc: Reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Nixon's resignation(n)

programme.title: Corrina, Corrina
programme.desc: Jessie Nelson's romantic drama, which she also wrote and produced, stars Ray Liotta as Manny Singer, a widower whose young daughter Molly has become almost catatonically withdrawn following her mother's death. Realising he needs help, Manny advertises for a housekeeper and selects Corrina Washington since Molly reacted positively to her. As Corrina draws Molly out of her shell, so Manny falls in love with her, but in 50s America, inter-racial relationships are still frowned on and the pair face prejudice from all sides as their relationship blossoms(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: Billy Bob Thornton plays Hank Grotowski, a prison guard whose son, who works on the prison's death row, commits suicide. Grotowski spirals into depression until one night he helps Leticia Musgrove's injured son. When he too dies, the couple are united by their grief, but as their relationship develops, he learns he and his son were party to the execution of her husband. Berry won an Oscar for her stunning performance in Marc Forster's gripping drama(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: John Travolta stars in this thriller as divorced husband and father Frank Morrison, a boat builder concerned about his son Danny (Matthew O'Leary), a troubled 11-year-old who has shown a tendency to lie since his parents broke up. When his ex-wife Susan (Teri Polo) announces that she's getting remarried to Rick Barnes (Vince Vaughn), a recent arrival in town and a popular, wealthy philanthropist, Frank struggles with jealousy but feels that Rick might be a stabilizing influence for his son. When Danny begins relating unsettling stories about Rick, Frank at first chalks it up to youthful rebellion, but when Danny stridently claims to have witnessed his new stepfather committing murder, Frank's instincts tell him the story is true. As he investigates the new man in his family's life, Frank uncovers alarming facts about Rick, who's not the man he appears to be. Domestic Disturbance (2001) made headlines six months before its release when co-star Steve Buscemi, accompanied by Vaughn and screenwriter Scott Rosenberg, was stabbed and seriously injured in an after-hours bar brawl with locals near the film's North Carolina set(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Sports biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards (Taron Egerton), whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics at Calgary marked the first time a Brit had ever competed in the ski-jumping event. Edwards trains as a ski jumper under the tutelage of a hard-drinking former champ (Hugh Jackman), and eventually finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best. Directed by Dexter Fletcher(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: Devastated Peter takes a Hawaii vacation in order to deal with recent break-up with his TV star girlfriend, Sarah. Little does he know Sarah's traveling to the same resort as her ex ... and she's bringing along her new boyfriend(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: The U.S. government decides to go after an agro-business giant with a price-fixing accusation, based on the evidence submitted by their star witness, vice president-turned-informant Mark Whitacre(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Andy Kaufman's public image changed like the weather: he was loved and hated in equal measure and his innovative style of humour was often misunderstood. He acknowledged that he didn't know what was funny or not, and his material could generate laughs and tears, silence and brawls(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: This incisive biographical drama written by Aaron Sorkin (The West Wing) explores the genius and shortcomings of computing guru Steve Jobs (Michael Fassbender) through the lens of three product launches(n)

programme.desc: Teenager Lydia Wade manages to escape a gang of masked men trying to abduct her and her friend Rosie, the daughter of a US Navy commander. programme.desc: The detectives investigate the attempted murder of a woman found beaten into a coma, and their only witness is her daughter, who has severe learning difficulties. programme.desc: A student counsellor is murdered in New York, and Benson and Stabler investigate a possible connection to her volunteer work at a refugee centre. programme.title: The Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: As maestro TV producer Stephen J. Cannell's latest foray into feature work, The Tooth Fairy represents the latest direct-to-video entry in an unofficial series of slasher films that resurrect friendly characters in a horrific vein -- from the 1997 Jack Frost to the 2005 Gingerdead Man. This particular outing begins with the legend of a woman known as "The Tooth Fairy," who lures unsuspecting children to her home with promises of gifts in exchange for their lost teeth, and then butchers them. The film implies, at its outset, that the homicidal slayer is long gone -- and that her home is being converted to a cozy bed and breakfast. Everyone believes the story -- until a young girl and her mother check into the inn. The child happens to be on the verge of losing a tooth, and all hell breaks loose. Chuck Bowman (A Kiss So Deadly) directs, from a teleplay co-authored by Cannell and Corey Strode(n)

programme.title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Musical fantasy based on Roald Dahl's Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. Charlie Bucket is a sweet boy from a poor family who dreams of finding one of five golden tickets hidden inside a chocolate bar wrapper which will admit him to the eccentric and reclusive Willy Wonka's magical chocolate factory. One after another tickets are discovered by ghastly children - but will Charlie find the last remaining one and have all his dreams come true?(n)

She is helped out by a brash mercenary, and together they search for the priceless gem located in the map. A non-stop mix of thrills, laughter and romance with energetic performances all round(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: An ex-convict tries to go straight, but while running a nightclub his drug-addicted lawyer and an ambitious young criminal make it difficult for him to get out of the life. Meanwhile, he tries to win back the woman he loves who doesn't trust that he's trying to stay on the right side of the law(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: Adapted from acclaimed author Richard Matheson's influential novelette of the same name, Constantine director Francis Lawrence's I Am Legend follows the last man on Earth as he struggles to survive while fending off the infected survivors of a devastating vampiric plague. A brilliant scientist who raced to discover a cure for the man-made virus as humanity came crumbling down all around him, Robert Neville (Will Smith) was inexplicably immune to the highly contagious superbug. Now the entire population of New York City -- and perhaps the world -- has been transformed into carnivorous bloodsuckers that fear the light and live solely to spread their contagion to any remaining living creature that crosses their path. It's been three years since civilization came to an end, and the loneliness has taken a devastating toll on Neville. By day he scours the city for food and supplies while sending out desperate radio messages in hopes that someone might respond, and by night he attempts to find a way to reverse the effects of the virus by experimenting with his own blood. But time is running out for Neville as the legions of infected watch his every move from the safety of the shadows, waiting for the perfect moment to strike. They, too, long to learn the secret that lurks in Neville's blood, though they will have to take caution while attempting to procure it because Neville will sooner die attempting to slay every last one of them than willingly giving up a single drop. Previously adapted for the screen in the 1964 Vincent Price frightener The Last Man on Earth and the 1971 Charlton Heston action film The Omega Man, Matheson's novelette also served as the inspiration for George A. Romero's groundbreaking zombie classic Night of the Living Dead(n)

programme.desc: Gar Balls. A home invasion by opossums forces T-Monkey to beg for help; P'Maw places a wager on the tastiest fish in the swamp(n)

programme.title: Swamp'd!
programme.desc: Goat Wedding. P'Maw wants to make jambalaya with an animal he hit with his car, but first has to send Ricky and T-Monkey to find it. Meanwhile, a goat wedding at the shop has P'Maw playing matchmaker(n)

programme.title: Missouri Mountain Family
programme.desc: Welcome to the Family. In the premiere of a series following a large family living in the wilderness of the Ozark Mountains, a harsh winter and a near-fatal accident threaten to derail the Haumessers' important projects, including a field burn to enrich the soil(n)

programme.title: Missouri Mountain Family
programme.desc: New Beginnings. The arrival of spring comes with preparations for Isaac and Emily's wedding and the family helping them build their new house(n)

programme.title: Missouri Mountain Family
programme.desc: One Step at a Time. The families take a break from large projects and focus on their own homes for a change(n)

programme.title: The Last Alaskans: No Man's Land
programme.desc: No Snow, No Go. While much is done during the warm months in Alaska, the winter is a vital time for trapping in order to provide both meat and fur. With unseasonably warm temperatures, the Alaskans are struggling to cover ground without the use of snowmobiles(n)

programme.title: The Last Alaskans: No Man's Land
programme.desc: Thieving Wolves. The Alaskans aren't the only ones in the wilderness hunting for game—the wolves are too. Normally, trap lines are a convenient way to catch multiple animals, but the wolves are using them as a buffet(n)

programme.title: Yukon Men: Roughing It
programme.desc: Taking on the Wolf Pack. Racers and spectators flock to Tanana for the annual dog sled race, but the biggest event in the village is under attack by a pack of wolves, and it's up to the people to protect the town(n)

programme.title: Yukon Men: Roughing It
programme.desc: Dead Winters Crossing. A cold snap pushes the temperature to 20 below; Stan faces a risky river crossing with a rusty lead dog(n)

programme.desc: The Bodyguard. Sophie is back in the fold, and she and Axel babysit for Rocket Dog while the clan is away, but Sophie's attention is diverted by the arrival of Wilson and Axel is left to defend the burrow alone, which puts the pups in danger(n)

programme.title: Meerkat Manor: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Divided We Fall. A showdown in the Kalahari involves an ambush by Maybelline and the Aztecs on Sophie and Simon, who are guarding Rocket Dog's pups, and willing to risk their lives doing so(n)

programme.title: Dogs 101
programme.desc: Puppies. A step-by-step guide to looking after puppies, from selecting the right type of dog for your lifestyle to preparing for its arrival(n)

programme.title: America's Cutest
programme.desc: Dog: Pup Stars. Dogs that crave the spotlight and ones that can't stay awake are featured(n)

programme.title: Bad Dog!
programme.desc: Pampered Pets. Chocolate lab Max has his own private wing of the house and cool cat Didga rides her skateboard to the beach. Plus, a micro-pig keeps rummaging bins for food(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Houston
programme.desc: Beyond the Call of Duty. Two emus need to be rounded up and brought back to the Houston SPCA, but their powerful kick and sharp claws make it dangerous; a routine seizure becomes an emergency rescue when a hoarder is investigated(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Houston
programme.desc: Extreme Rescues. When investigator Stephen Goldman checks in on a breeder's kennels, he finds nearly 100 American bulldogs living in atrocious conditions and close to death(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Not Meant to Be. An adopter arrives from Texas, but is crushed when he doesn't connect with the dog he had selected, though Tia has another animal in mind that could be an ideal match. Meanwhile, two prison guards come to Villalobos to observe a work-release inmate(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Perfect Match. A looming tropical storm threatens to ruin Tania and Perry's wedding; Tia ventures into a dangerous part of New Orleans to rescue a mother dog that's been left to die(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Sky High Pirate Hideout. A pirate-theme tree house is built for a couple on the Pacific coast that has a 50-foot rope bridge, heated floors and hidden compartments(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: High Noon Saloon. A Wild West tree house is built in the shape of a horseshoe. Details include a jail-themed loft and a copper ceiling(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Twin Fix. Tree houses get makeovers when Pete returns to two of his first builds, which are in need of far more than just remodelling(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Texas-Sized Treehouse. The crew goes to Texas to build a large structure in cypress trees on the banks of the Frio River that features the longest bridge in the company's history(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Rustic English Re-tree-t. A job on a farm in North Carolina entails building a replica of an elegant English retreat with a hanging bed(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Treehouse Z. Pete has a nine-day window to build a Zen-like sanctuary 15 feet high with a view of the Blue Ridge Mountains in North Carolina(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Apres Skihouse Treehouse. A 20-ft. high ski chalet is built as a winter retreat that features a secret bedroom and a double-sided fireplace(n)

programme.desc: Musician Hideouts. Pete's treehouses are creative on their own, but his clients are stepping it up by requesting a fully functional recording studio perched on high for a couple of Billboard Award winning superstars(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Treehouse Point 2.0!. In the series premiere, Pete's son Charlie is in charge of a new construction project that will expand the Nelson's tree-house empire on 23 acres of forest and include an arboreal home for Charlie(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: The wildlife of the mountains, finding out about ravens, the golden eagles of the Scottish hills and asking whether the UK will ever again play host to a long-lost beast - the lynx.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Lucy Alexander explore a substantial building in Kent that has been divided into flats along with a three-bedroom house, small workshops in Derbyshire and a one-bedroom flat in Surrey. All of the buildings are being sold at auction and are in need of modernisation, and the presenters talk to the new owners about their renovation plans after the sales, before checking on their progress a few months later.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford and Chris Bavin try to settle the age-old argument of whether tea and coffee are good or bad for the health. Plus, whether reusing plastic bottles is a bad idea.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the apparently growing problem of bedbugs, in hotels and on planes. Plus, the dangers of jellyfish.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Leominster, Herefordshire, as Paul Laidlaw and Mark Ashley help the teams raise the most money. Natasha also shows off her favourite ceramic frog.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Liam is desperate to prove Rachel is lying about her and Brian. Adrijan suspects Jack O'Reilly is behind the attack on Sean, and Bridget is desperate to settle her debt.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple wanting to relocate from the coast to the Herefordshire countryside on a budget of £330,000. Plus, the presenter finds out about a mobile cider press.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages a rusty drill press, a post-war chair and some wooden blocks from being discarded in Walsall, and attempts to make a profit through renovating them.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Gloucester Cathedral, presenter Paul Martin and experts Philip Serrell and Michael Baggott unearth some unusual items among the antiques and collectibles brought along to the valuation day. Philllip discovers there are still bargains to be found at car boot sales, and an exquisite Italian micromosaic necklace sparks Michael's interest. Meanwhile, Paul fulfils a lifetime's dream when he runs away to Gloucester-based circus, Giffords, and learns a few tricks of the trade from its famous clown, Tweedy.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Clive, Hilary and Rebecca from the south-west of England and Welsh farmer Barbara are hoping to win prizes for their best pigs at the Dorset County Show.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A smug Max makes things worse for an oblivious Lauren, while Carmel turns to Denise for support when she unexpectedly receives divorce papers from Umar. Sonia discovers Dot has been overcharged for multiple bills, but the stubborn pensioner refuses to accept any help, and Derek is touched by Johnny's latest actions.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: Matt Allwright, Steph McGovern and Nikki Fox ask whether airlines are breaking new rules designed to ensure delayed passengers get what they are entitled to, and test out cleanliness and hygiene standards on trains. Rogue Traders exposes a business whose tactics may be breaking the law.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Adil Ray is the latest celebrity uncovering facts about his heritage in the genealogy documentary. The Citizen Kahn star's mother came to England from newly independent Kenya in 1967, and now he identifies himself as Muslim, Pakistani, African and Brummie. Adil heads to east Africa to find out more about his lineage, tracing his mixed Asian and African ancestry across Kenya to Uganda, meeting relatives for the first time in the traditional kingdom of Buganda and investigating a rumoured link to royalty.(n)

programme.title: One Deadly Weekend in America
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of a single July weekend in the US when seven young people were shot. Told through the stories of survivors, witnesses, families and law enforcement agencies, as well as newsreels, CCTV and police videos, the film paints a dramatic portrait of America's troubling relationship with guns.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: Colin Stafford-Johnson and Lucy Cooke examine wildlife in cities, observing a seabird with a liking for high-rise living in Newcastle and the red fox's urban habits in Brighton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Lucy Alexander explore a Cornish farmhouse with stunning coastal views, a garden flat in Essex and a Grade II-listed Georgian property in Kent. All of the buildings are being sold at auction and are in need of modernisation, and the presenters talk to the new owners about their renovation plans after the sales, before checking on their progress a few months later.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Chris Bavin and Gloria Hunniford assess the risk posed by saturated fats, and contemplate whether there an easy way for a person to switch off their appetite. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville test out claims that airlines are snooping on customer's flight searches in order to hike up fares. Plus, Simon Calder offers tips on visiting Dubai. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts as two teams seek items of value at a wet and windy Newark antiques fair, hoping to profilt from their purchases later on at auction. Experts Charles Hanson and Phillip Serrell lend a hand with their buyng decisions.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: There is concern over whether the costly christening party will pass off peacefully. Relations are strained between Sean and Adrijan, while Brian seeks to reconcile with his wife.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: With a budget of £375,000 to play with, Ginny Buckley joins in the search for a rural home in north Devon with adjoining land for animals. During her time in the county, Ginny joins the harvest at a traditional Devonshire orchard where over 70 of the country's heritage apple varieties are grown.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore oversees the renovation of a sewing machine, a tin bath and a box of old taps acquired from a tip in Surrey. Artist blacksmith Bex takes on the challenge of the bath, turning it into a designer delight, while the sewing machine is transformed by furniture guru Rupert, and Sarah takes on the taps herself. The hope is that all three items will secure a profit thanks to their overhaul.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at Wrest Park, Bedfordshire, as experts Christina Trevanion and Anita Harper take a look at the collectibles brought in by the public. Paul also takes a stroll down the high street of Amersham to explore the market town's history.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Series celebrating inspirational farming families and the rural events where they showcase their hard work, as they try to win the top prizes. The Cheddar-making Clothier family and goat's cheese-maker Roger compete against the cream-of-the-crop at the prestigious Global Cheese Awards at Frome. Narrated by Bill Paterson.(n)

programme.title: Thief Trackers
programme.desc: GPS technology helps the team members follow a man has stolen a tablet computer and they track him over a thousand miles to Warsaw and back, eventually catching up with him at a London airport. In Bath, a man gets his much-loved Land Rover returned after a police chase across to the Welsh border, and staff at a traffic management company are glad that they fitted trackers to their vans when one of then get stolen.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As Carmel prepares for her date with Max, Denise realises what is going on - but her friend insists she is going out with another man, not Max. Later, the pair enjoy a romantic evening which ends up back at a hotel - where one thing leads to another. Shirley overhears Mick and Fi discussing her future at the Vic, and upset she tells Mick she is leaving the business. Kush and Shakil talk about their mother's divorce, and Sonia thanks Ted for helping out with Dot.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: The neighbourhood prepares for a wedding, and Granville gets into the spirit of things by putting up a large display to bring a bit of cheeriness to his shop window. However, the reluctant groom has cold feet, and it falls to the miserly shopkeeper to ensure he makes it to the church on time. The marital atmosphere also has a marked effect on Mrs Featherstone, who steps up her search for a fourth husband - with Granville and Mr Newbold finding themselves likely candidates to be the next lucky man.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career. There's a dead body down at the Phoenix Club, John and Kayleigh have an uninvited passenger, and Peter wows an audience of 15,000 with his shovel. Featuring an appearance by Queen. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy seems reluctant to reveal any information about her new boyfriend, Mark refuses to talk about why his wife has thrown him out, and Dermot lies to his fiancee's parents about his job - all of which makes Agnes feel her family is becoming too secretive. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy play hot-tub fantasy date with Anna and Toby - and soon find themselves landing in hot water. One-time Spice Girl Emma Bunton and Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent appear as themselves, alongside regulars Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.(n)

programme.title: The Sentinel
programme.desc: A secret service agent is convinced a member of a neo-Nazi militant group has infiltrated the White House. But his attempt to investigate comes to a halt when he is framed for murder and blackmailed over his affair with the president's wife. As he battles to clear his name, his former protege is given the task of bringing him to justice. Spy thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Kiefer Sutherland, Eva Longoria and Kim Basinger.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Alison Hammond to pick the TV shows that shaped her life, with the This Morning reporter revealing which American superstar was a great inspiration to her.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: Lucy Cooke and Colin Stafford-Johnson explore the waters surrounding the UK, discovering how the white-tailed sea eagle has made a dramatic return to the coast.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw oversees proceedings in Lincoln as a father-and-daughter team takes on a mother-and-daughter duo, each buying three items in the hope of making the most profit at auction. Experts Kate Bliss and Raj Bisram are on hand to advise.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North West chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Greg Rusedski. Greg, a former British number one tennis player, understands the high standards expected at his sport's Grand Slam contests, in this Wimbledon-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the North East heats sees returning champion Tommy Banks and newcomers Danny Parker and Josh Overington prepare their starters. Tommy draws inspiration from the traditional celebration of midsummer, Danny creates a dish using 22 vegetables, while Josh's centres on a savoury strawberry veloute.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Jules Hudson explore Northamptonshire.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner explore the cuisine and culture of Gloucestershire, beginning in Crickley Hill, where a barefoot forager teaches them about the culinary secrets of the woodland. The pair then follow in the footsteps of one of Britain's most notable composers by taking the Holst Walk through the Cotswold countryside, before they encounter some very happy Gloucester Old Spot pigs at Todenham Manor Farm.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott serves up a seafood special and his catches of the day include a fish pie from Mary Berry, a crab and leek tart from the Hairy Bikers, Nigel Slater's mackerel and bacon salad, a lobster dish from James Martin and Lorraine Pascale's fish and chips.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Saba Douglas Hamilton and the elephant rescue team race to save the life of a recently orphaned calf. The baby elephant is flown to an elephant orphanage in Nairobi, but with a terror threat on the Kenya's East coast, the family's safari camp is also in crisis. Saba must work to save the business and do all she can to protect Samburu's trusting elephants.(n)

programme.title: Hive Alive
programme.desc: Part one of two. Naturalist and Springwatch presenter Chris Packham and journalist and beekeeping enthusiast Martha Kearney are joined by Professor Adam Hart to explore the remarkable secrets of the lives and habits of bees. Midsummer is a critical time for the insects as they must gather enough food for the winter, so a specially designed hive equipped with an array of cutting-edge technology is used to monitor them and find out how they do it. The team also puts the latest scientific findings about bees to the test.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Chimps of the Lost Gorge.
programme.desc: Documentary providing an insight into the lives of chimpanzees in Uganda's Kyambura Gorge, a deep, forested ravine running through the African savannah. For 15 years, the gorge has been cut off from the rest of the jungle, leaving the animals stranded with limited sources of food. The programme follows the 20 remaining chimps as alpha male Brutus tries to retain control of the family in its daily struggle to survive.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Chenies Manor, near Amersham in Buckinghamshire, where members of the public bring along treasured antiques and collectibles. A young woman chooses a 21st birthday present from a collection of pocket watches kept in a biscuit tin and a train set that has been in its box for 70 years finally sees the light of day. Fiona reads a letter from a soldier to be opened in the event of his death, the relatives of a glassblower pay a moving tribute to their father's work and the update feature focuses on an ornate French plant stand first seen on the show in 1991.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo search for bargains in East Anglia, with experts David Harper and James Braxton to assist them. Antonio learns about the brave fishermen of Suffolk who saved mariners' lives while risking their own and Gennaro takes a trip to see a very special bird.(n)

programme.title: 10 Puppies and Us
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following young dogs and their new owners over the course of their all-important first six months together. The first episode features Chihuahua Chloe, setting up residence in an east London nail salon. She immediately wants to befriend 10-year-old Rocky, formerly top dog in the household, but Rocky is not interested. Meanwhile, border collie Jura joins a ski patroller in the highlands of Scotland, rescue pup Pedro arrives in the Surrey countryside from Spain and golden retriever Lola joins Hampshire family the Payes.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.sub-title: Top of the Lake: China Girl: China Girl.
programme.desc: New series. Elizabeth Moss returns in this follow-up to Jane Campion's 2013 crime drama. Detective Robin Griffin is back in Sydney, eager to throw herself into her work, while secretly planning to search for the daughter she gave up for adoption. However, when a suitcase containing the body of a young woman washes up on Bondi Beach, Robin and her new partner Miranda begin an investigation that leads them into the dark side of Sydney's sex industry - with reverberations they could never have imagined. Nicole Kidman and Gwendoline Christie co-star.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Cleverman
programme.desc: After Slade tries to capture Koen and Kora by force, Waruu challenges Koen to use his powers, save the Hairypeople and confront the Namorrodor before it is too late.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Birmingham landlord Samuel is just 25 but already has a portfolio of 13 properties worth more than £1million in total, and lives off the combined rental income with his wife Amanda. The couple spend a week living in one of their houses, rented by mother-of-two Marie, to experience life from her perspective. Also taking part are husband-and-wife duo Paul and Sharon from Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, who move into a two-bedroom flat rented by Chris and Courtney. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Enforcement officer Alan Pennington heads to a scrap yard to recover money owed to a mechanic who was sold a faulty engine, and Sheriffs Lawrence and Kev face a very tricky problem as they deal with the repossession of a garage business. Meanwhile, Sheriffs Tommy and Craig take a High Court Writ to one of Britain's biggest and most famous companies - but how will they track down the right person who can make the payment that the company's former employee is owed?.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: TV personality Johnny Ball joins Brian Conley to look back at the classic TV that made him the person he is, including the shows he watched every week when he was in the RAF.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: The wildlife of the mountains, finding out about ravens, the golden eagles of the Scottish hills and asking whether the UK will ever again play host to a long-lost beast - the lynx.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from Leominster, Herefordshire, as Paul Laidlaw and Mark Ashley help the teams raise the most money. Natasha also shows off her favourite ceramic frog.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to prune summer flowering shrubs, makes plans for autumn flowers and returns to Dublin to find out how Helen Dillon is progressing in her new garden. Joe Swift shows how good design should not hinder challenging conditions when he visits a garden in Kent, Rachel de Thame explores the vital role of scent in wild flowers and the insects that visit them, and Nick Bailey prepares designs for a weekend project that will transform a front garden into a beautiful and practical space. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven journeys in style to the Lake District, while Julia Bradbury is on two wheels.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner are in north Essex, where they visit the Warner Textile Museum, Colne Valley Railway, and Wash Fruit Farm, with the chef cooking guinea fowl with herbs and a queen of puddings with scented lavender. Plus, chef Jahdre Hayward prepares a dish of cod, with vegetables from his own garden.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives for party food, including Lorraine Pascale's chocolate lollipops, seafood dishes by James Martin and Rachel Khoo's coq-au-vin on a stick.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The safari camp reopens after the rainy season, but Saba Douglas-Hamilton worst nightmare is turning into reality. She has a houseful of guests on their way, but the cupboards are bare and there's nowhere for them to sleep. Her husband Frank Pope has problems of his own as he attempts to fit a tracking device to a six-ton bull elephant.(n)

programme.title: Hive Alive
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Martha Kearney conclude their quest with Professor Adam Hart to explore the remarkable secrets of the lives and habits of bees. They discover how many of the tagged insects have survived over the frenetic midsummer week of nectar and pollen gathering and find out if they have collected enough food at this critical time to see them through the winter. They also investigate the deadly mating ritual of a queen and look at how bees can aid medical research, as well as how people can help them in return.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming: World Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of day six from Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which will include the final of the men's 4x200m freestyle relay discipline, as well as the women's 100m freestyle event. With expert analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts a game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comic and entertainer Jim Moir - aka Vic Reeves - and his wife Nancy Sorrell take to the road with experts Charlie Ross and Thomas Plant. Traveling through Kent, Jim brings his unique brand of humour to the business of buying antiques, while model and TV presenter Nancy knows a thing or two about bargaining and proves to be very competitive.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: New series. John Humphrys and the famous black chair return for another season of the specialist and general knowledge quiz, as the first batch of 96 contenders start the long journey towards the final. Needless to say, only one can ultimately be crowned Mastermind Champion.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: New series. Victoria Coren Mitchell returns with the quiz show as further teams of three people use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, hoping to succeed reigning champions the Verbivores. Typical rounds they need to negotiate are termed connections, sequences, connecting wall and missing vowels. In this opening edition of the 13th series, three Tolkien fans take on a church team, with one set of clues consisting of pat: bone, rub: disease, nut: spread and salmon: bacteria.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes steps to ensure that fruits and vegetables give maximum cropping by dispensing advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as revealing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants that will carry on flowering into the autumn. Carol Klein meets writer Roy Lancaster as he reminisces on his life. Roy is a former Gardeners' World presenter, and with the programme's half-centenary in mind Rachel de Thame reflects on how people used to garden 50 years ago. Plus, Joe Swift and Flo Headlam help a community create a garden in Wiltshire. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Comedian, novelist and presenter David Baddiel, comedian, actress and writer Cariad Lloyd and stand-up comedian and actor Ross Noble join regular panellist Alan Davies and recently installed host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate questions and facts on the theme `nature and nurture'. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult to crack that points are instead awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Cleverman
programme.desc: Koen seeks help from Aunty Linda to try to restore Kora to her own dimension, while Slade persuades Charlotte to have one last attempt at IVF, but appears to be hiding something.(n)

programme.title: Cleverman
programme.desc: Koen must send Kora back to her own dimension and confront the Namorrodor, while Charlotte realises something is very wrong with her pregnancy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Royal Welsh Show
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets up with the blacksmiths and Gareth Wyn Jones gets to grips with the fast-paced mounted games and looks at some of his livestock favourites. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis charts the stories behind the shipwrecks of the Georgian age, when Britain's naval fleet was considered the most powerful in the world. He learns how mutinous sailors, rebellious slaves and murderous wreckers threatened to undermine the country's dominance at sea at a time when it was establishing key colonies and acquiring new territories.(n)

programme.title: Prejudice and Pride: The People's History of LGBTQ Britain
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary in which people share the items that have defined their lives in the 50 years since homosexuality was partially decriminalised in 1967. They include a rare collection of the first openly gay magazine - featuring the rising young singer David Bowie - to letters from worried parents of newly `out' daughters and sons. Presented by Stephen K Amos and Susan Calman. Part of the Gay Britannia season.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining class divisions on trains, with separate carriages for first, second and third class passengers. Over time, trains acted as a catalyst, with people travelling to regions and places for the first time, as well as changing the nation's relationship with royalty and developing a stronger sense of shared identity and culture. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside.(n)

programme.title: King Alfred and the Anglo-Saxons
programme.desc: Michael Wood explores the role played by Alfred the Great's daughter Aethelflaed in England's battles in civil war and against the Vikings. The presenter contemplates how England `may never have happened' without the young ruler of Mercia, who led armies, built fortresses, was a skilled diplomat in campaigning against the Norse invaders, and became a beloved leader in the British Isles.(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis charts the stories behind the shipwrecks of the Georgian age, when Britain's naval fleet was considered the most powerful in the world. He learns how mutinous sailors, rebellious slaves and murderous wreckers threatened to undermine the country's dominance at sea at a time when it was establishing key colonies and acquiring new territories.(n)

programme.title: Prejudice and Pride: The People's History of LGBTQ Britain
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary in which people share the items that have defined their lives in the 50 years since homosexuality was partially decriminalised in 1967. They include a rare collection of the first openly gay magazine - featuring the rising young singer David Bowie - to letters from worried parents of newly `out' daughters and sons. Presented by Stephen K Amos and Susan Calman. Part of the Gay Britannia season.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Known as Flash Harry, Malcolm Sargent was the chief conductor of the Proms for two decades, bringing the concerts to TV audiences for the first time. Marking the 50th anniversary of his death, the BBC Symphony Orchestra, under conductor Andrew Davis, and pianist Beatrice Rana recreate Sargent's 500th Prom from 1966. Alongside Schumann and Berlioz, there's a feast of English music, including works by Elgar and Holst, culminating in Britten's much-loved Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra. Presented by Katie Derham.(n)

programme.title: Chopin Etudes
programme.desc: At Chateau de Neuville near Paris, Freddie Kempf performs Opus 10, No11. Written as piano studies, these are brief but exacting works, designed to test both the technical skill of the pianist and their musical abilities.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Recalling the music of Manchester, where long before the advent of Madchester, the city was serenaded by local outfits Herman's Hermits and the Hollies.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Jarvis Cocker leads an eclectic line-up in this tribute to the 1960s cult icon Scott Walker. Conductor Jules Buckley has arranged tracks from Walker's four eponymous albums, and here they are performed with live orchestral backing for the very first time, courtesy of Jules Buckley's Heritage Orchestra and London Contemporary Voices. The other performers are Susanne Sundfor, John Grant and Richard Hawley.(n)

programme.title: Reginald D Hunter's Songs of the South
programme.desc: The London-based comedian continues his exploration of the American South through its songs both past and present in Alabama, where he attends a Lynyrd Skynyrd gig and learns about the city of Muscle Shoals' role in the development of soul. Reg then heads to his home state of Georgia, where he visits Athens - where rock bands the B52s and REM originated - and Atlanta, the birthplace of civil rights leader Martin Luther King and rapper Ludacris. Featuring contributions by Arrested Development, St Paul and the Broken Bones, Clarence Carter and Sharon Jones.(n)
