programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Lyle convinces Karen to marry him in Las Vegas, where she bumps into Jennifer Lopez - and persuades her to sing at their wedding. She also meets her fiance's strangely affectionate brother, while Leo returns from Cambodia with bad news for Will. First in a two-part series finale, also guest starring John Cleese, Tim Curry and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rosario causes a stir on the dance floor, while Will tries to persuade Leo to tell Grace the truth. Lyle's eloquent speech at the reception does not receive the response he anticipated from Karen, and Jack is stunned by an offer from Jennifer Lopez. Guest starring John Cleese, Harry Connick Jr and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray tricks Debra into letting him play golf - but finds it difficult to put a good round together as he contends with a guilty conscience. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is shocked to discover his parents planned to divorce when he was a child, and only stayed together to help him recover from an accident. Tormented by the thought they have never really been happy together, he begins to blame himself for all the misery in their marriage.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Cranes set off on a road trip in a motor home, but Martin complicates matters by inadvertently driving into Canada - which means they have to try to sneak Daphne back across the border due to the terms of her American visa. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier decide to collaborate on a self-help book about sibling relationships. After struggling to write it they lock themselves in a hotel room until it is finished, but petty jealousy reigns and the Crane brothers are soon at each other's throats.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Food critic Gil takes over the radio show to cover for an ailing Frasier - who immediately fears his job is under threat and resolves to get back on air without delay. Comedy, starring Edward Hibbert and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart, Homer and Lisa eat too many sweets and suffer from nightmares on the most spooky night of the year - Halloween. Lisa accidentally leaves the world defenceless from an alien invasion, Bart's Village of the Damned-style mind power turns his dad into a jack-in-the-box and Homer becomes Mr Burns's robot. Featuring the guest voice of James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer buys Lisa a pony in a bid to prove his love for her, but the family cannot afford the gift. To make ends meet and pay for the animal's upkeep, he is forced to take on a second job at the Kwik-E-Mart.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In north Devon, married couple Frankie and husband Jason kick off the competition. Outspoken duo Kate and Ian don't let the evening's many delays go unnoticed, and as tensions rise around the table, internet lovebirds Chris and Amy try to stay firmly out of the way. Day two sees Kate and Ian serve up a menu full of rustic French cuisine, influenced by their 22 years living in France. But a table laying mishap suggests that Kate has overtly snubbed her guests, although tensions are eased when former falconers Kate and Ian bring out one of their favourite birds of prey. Finally it's dog lovers Chris and Amy's turn to step up to the plate, and believing themselves to be the foodies of the group they're confident they can bag the prize for best soiree.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Former model Cathy brings in her collection of designer bags and jewellery, hoping to secure a £50,000 loan to help her launch a lingerie business, while Prestige boss James Constantinou attracts unwanted attention when he goes for a spin in a client's Ferrari. A woman wants to pawn her grandfather's First World War medals to raise money for her mother's funeral, and an inventor decides to part with his precious watch.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with comedian and presenter Jenny Eclair helping Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Stacey is determined to bring the girls together. It's a plan that may see her end up as the final foreman - or she may just cause further arguments.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Berkshire charity worker Lynda Feymor find a place in Portugal's Eastern Algarve, looking at five properties within her budget of £175,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Float by Boat near Rugby, partners Kev Argent and Tor Johnson run mindfulness breaks from their narrowboat, but Alison and Lynda are not keen on the tiny shared bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Windsor is hosted by retired sales manager Angie, who is planning some 1960s fun. However, her guests are not impressed by the rules she lays down at the beginning.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa joins an environmental protection group and begins campaigning in a last-ditch attempt to prevent the city's oldest redwood tree being felled by a rich Texan. With the voice of Joshua Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ellie and Brody continue to flirt, while Holly feels uncomfortable. Elsewhere, Shane messes things up once again, and Kim faces a big change in her life.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Portugal v England.
programme.desc: Portugal v England (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the concluding match in Group D for both sides, which takes place at Koning Willem II Stadion in Tilburg, Netherlands. England's record in this tournament since the turn of the century leaves a lot to be desired, and while they did finish as runners-up in 2009, at the other tournaments staged in 2001, 2005 and 2013 they failed to progress to the knockout stage on any occasion, and had a combined record of one win, two draws and six losses. Tonight's match will be followed by highlights of Scotland v Spain. Presented by Clare Balding, with expert analysis from Jermaine Jenas, Eniola Aluko and Kim Little. Coverage of Scotland v Spain is available on More4.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The best and funniest moments from the recent series, including armchair TV reviews of Culinary Genius, Britain's Got Talent, Line of Duty, Cruising with Jane McDonald, University Challenge and First Dates. Plus, news reports featuring Diane Abbott, squirrels and young children gate-crashing a serious interview.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Proving the authenticity of internet videos, including a game of table tennis being played with kitchen knives and a sound system pumping out bass so loud it turns a car to jelly.(n)

programme.title: Excluded at Seven
programme.desc: In 2017, record numbers of children are being permanently excluded from primary schools. Filmed over two terms at The Rosebery - a short stay school in Norfolk - this Cutting Edge documentary follows six excluded primary children who make up its youngest class.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre ER
programme.desc: Featuring a man who slashed his scalp on a toilet roll holder, a lad who overdosed on holiday sun, and a man almost decapitated by a passing coach. Narrated by Tom Davis.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, the CEO of Retro Fitness, poses as a contestant on a reality show who is trying to win money to open his own gym. He hopes to highlight methods that will ensure success as he expands the business, and discovers whether his own employees are passionate about the brand.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined around the tasting table by First Dates maitre d' Fred Sirieix, food writer William Sitwell, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put tea, croissants and barbecue pork ribs to the test. The quickfire public taste challenge involves rice pudding.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners struggling to sell their properties in south Liverpool compete to sell their homes to buyers Simon and Claire. After touring each other's houses, they then have £1,000 to make improvements - with Michelle and Jim toning down their wallpaper, Karen renovating her garden, and Catherine and Jack updating their cluttered playroom.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for a Cambridgeshire home for Mary and David, who recently became parents for the first time. However, they are also challenged to find a house for the baby's maternal grandparents Edna and George, who have moved to the area to be close to their extended family.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with comedian and presenter Jenny Eclair helping Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen uses Jack's connections with guest star Jennifer Lopez to promote her newly penned song FYI - I Hurt, Too. Grace is frustrated by Leo's infidelity, but Will bears the brunt of her anger. Megan Mullally and Sean Hayes star.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Jack auditions to be a dancer for guest star Janet Jackson, but Karen has other ideas. Meanwhile, a broken-hearted Grace becomes addicted to attending Alcoholics Anonymous meetings and causes friction between Will and Vince.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra worries that Ray is happier at work than at home, and persuades him to set up an office in the house. American comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra decides to have a go at writing a children's book, but makes the mistake of asking Ray to help - little realising his competitive streak will jeopardise the entire project. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.desc: For years, London's East End was denied a new bridge because of the need to guarantee passage of ships up and down the Thames. For years, the greatest engineers of the age hunted for a design that would keep both road and water traffic moving. As Rob Bell explains, the solution came from architect Horace Jones, whose revolutionary design, with its thousand-tonne opening sections, was powered by nothing more than water. Rob also explains the bridge was lucky to survive the Second World War, having been a target for German V-1 flying bombs.(n)

programme.title: Drain the Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the infamous disappearances of ships and aircraft, adopting the rather unorthodox technique of exploring the area's ominous reputation by `draining the water from it' to see what exactly lies below the surface of the mythical triangle. Data from sophisticated sonar surveys enables the ocean floor to be seen, revealing strange geological features. The programme then contemplates whether they have had any influence on the mysterious occurrences that have been documented over the years.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother

She chats to the winner about life in the house, why they think they have won and how it feels to be back in the outside world. There'll also be a roll-call of all the evictees from the series and a speedy look at what the housemates got up to yesterday. And fans needn't worry - the normal series may be over for another year, but Celebrity Big Brother promises to return soon. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon

programme.desc: Lesser of Two Evils. While visiting Past-O-Rama, Fry is mistaken for an employee and has to park an antique 20th century car. He crashes it and ends up meeting Flexo, a joking robot that looks just like Bender only he has a goatee. Bender and Flexo become friends and go to the robot strip club, but Fry thinks that he's evil. He joins the Planet Express crew on a sensitive mission to deliver an important atom to the Miss Universe Pageant. Fry stays up all night to watch over Flexo, but he ends up falling asleep during his own shift. When they get to the pageant, the atom has been stolen and Flexo is gone. Everyone looks for him, leading to a battle between the two robots(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: How Hermes Requisitioned His Groove Back
programme.desc: How Hermes Requisitioned His Groove Back. Leela invites her old co-workers from the cryogenics lab over for a game of poker. When Bender uses x-ray specs to cheat, Leela's friends beat him up and inadvertently destroy Hermes' office. The anal-retentive Central Bureaucracy officer Morgan Proctor (voice of Nora Dunn) sees Hermes negligence and suspends him, appointing herself to take his place. Dr. Zoidberg suggests that Hermes spend some time at a health spa, but it turns out to be a slave labor camp. Meanwhile, Morgan tries to shape up the Planet Express offices and starts up a secret affair with Fry when she reveals her attraction to his slovenly ways. When Bender catches them, Morgan downloads his brain onto a disc and sends it to Central Bureaucracy. Finally, Hermes comes back and straightens everything out(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel and Joe volunteer at the school dance, but get themselves kicked out by the school's vice principal for bad behaviour. Meanwhile, Ryder considers breaking up with Stella. Family comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: After Dre's children turn their noses up at his favourite cheap restaurant in his old neighbourhood, he insists that they all get part-time jobs.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben, Riley, Danny and Tucker wonder where their own lives are heading when Bonnie delegates a very important job to them. Riley feels conflicted about her relationships with Ben and Danny, and Bonnie makes a decision that leaves everyone feeling frustrated.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Bonnie promotes Riley to chief bridesmaid and demands a crazy hen party, while Brad asks Danny to be his best man and throw an epic stag do. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall's friends try to help him get over his break-up with Lily - but just when it seems like he might be cheering up, he discovers she may be back in town. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.sub-title: Call Me When You Get There.

Meanwhile, Pops refuses to wear an emergency alert bracelet and is forced to call Adam when he suffers a fall. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly is determined to make friends with her reserved and softly spoken neighbours, the Kremps, so she bombards them with invitations to a barbecue. programme.desc: Penny is left in a difficult professional situation when a doctor (guest star Billy Bob Thornton) turns up at her door following her flirtatious sales technique, so the guys try to help her out. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang recreates a prom night on the roof of the apartment building when the girls decide they would like to re-enact their evenings with their current partners. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Joe is forced to quickly make a decision that could affect his and Mel's marriage after his new wife drops a bombshell at the ceremony. Meanwhile, Lennox is caught between Zander and Marco, and Ryder struggles to find the right time to make an announcement about college.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey

programme.desc: Riley is determined to set Ben up with Zoey, believing they would be perfect together. programme.title: Baby Daddy

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica's new job at the department store is put in jeopardy when Beverly takes advantage of her daughter's employee discount too frequently. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon panics when Leonard announces he has to go into hospital for surgery, and the impending divorce of Raj's parents motivates Howard and Bernadette to work on their own marriage. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon bids an emotional goodbye to Fun with Flags as he and Amy record the final instalment of the internet show. Leonard, Howard and Raj clear out the office of a recently deceased professor and take a peek at his research. Guest starring LeVar Burton.(n)

programme.desc: Mel gets a strange visit from her doctor, who drops by at Halloween to try to convince her that she was once a powerful teenage witch. Return of the comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: As Mel and Joe prepare for their first Christmas together as a couple, competition heats up over whose ornament should take the prestigious top spot on the tree. programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Danny is desperate to build bridges with Riley after their recent break-up, but she's still furious after learning that he hooked up with Sam in high school. Meanwhile, Ben tries to save face with Zoey after discovering that her ex-boyfriend has returned and wants to get back together with her.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy

programme.title: Black-ish

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: Dino Gangs
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dr Phil Currie goes on a quest to prove that Tyrannosaurus rex were more intelligent and far more dangerous than ever imagined, and that they hunted in deadly, killer packs. With his groundbreaking new findings and extensive research, the palaeontologist and dino hunter challenges the very foundations of traditional dinosaur theories.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor heads to the coast of west Africa, where he begins by hunting for the Atlantic sailfish. In Guinea-Bissau, he hauls out two red snappers and a bigeye jackfish, before landing himself a marbled grouper, renowned for being one of the tastiest fish to eat. The following morning, Robson visits a large wreck full of sea life, hoping to catch his first barracuda, but things do not go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough turns his attention to the network of partnerships that invertebrates have developed with one another and with plants. He reveals how the fairy wasp, the world's smallest insect, flies underwater to inject its eggs into those of the water beetle. Footage also shows how the caterpillar of the blue butterfly smuggles its way into an ants' nest by mimicking the smell of their young.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Shedding light on the behaviour of animals that migrate.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.(n)

programme.title: Dino Gangs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Phil Currie explores the hunting behaviour of the Tyrannosaurus rex, arguing the creatures worked in packs and tore their prey to shreds in frenzied attacks. Dr Currie journeys to some of the most remote and inhospitable places on the planet in search of evidence that may reveal how just how brutally the tyrant lizard king lorded over their domain, and why their reign of terror lasted so long.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor heads to Cuba, where he begins by fishing with locals on an esplanade in Havana. He then visits one of the country's biggest rivers, the Rio Hatiguanico, to hunt for tarpon, before travelling to the remote island of Cayo Romano in search of bonefish. Having landed some impressive game fish, Robson sails to a reef near Trinidad marina in the hope of catching something for his dinner.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores how insects compensate for their small size by banding together in vast numbers. He reveals that the operations of many of these societies are so finely tuned they appear to work as a single entity. Footage shows how African termite mounds act as huge ventilation systems of such sophistication that humans are only now beginning to unravel the mechanics of the structure.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.desc: 1993. Surely one of Bill Murray's finest hours - again and again! A TV weatherman finds himself endlessly reliving the same day when he travels to the small town of Punxsutawney. Dir: Harold Ramis(n)

programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.desc: The Grim Reaper grants a tycoon a few extra days of life in this remake of 1934's "Death Takes a Holiday"(n)

programme.desc: Maniacal doll Chucky and his bride go on a killing spree in Hollywood after being resurrected by their gentle offspring(n)

programme.title: There's Something About Mary
programme.desc: This smash hit, gross-out comedy is laugh-out-loud funny and stars Ben Stiller and Cameron Diaz. Ted decides that, ever since an unfortunate accident with a zipper made him miss the prom with the lovely Mary, his life has been a failure. 13 years later he hires a detective to track her down but, when he succeeds, the detective also falls in love with her. Soon Ted finds himself competing for Mary's affections with a man who will stop at nothing to win her over. Unmissable, if only for the notorious 'hair gel' scene(n)

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Two children discover a mysterious board game in their attic. As they roll the dice, out pops Alan -a man who has been trapped inside for 26 years - and a jungle-full of wild animals. Family(n)

programme.title: Bowfinger
programme.desc: A desperate movie producer will stop at nothing to make his movie with the biggest actor in Hollywood, so he finds a nerdy look-alike to be his star(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Edward Norton and Brad Pitt star in David Fincher's Oscar-nominated drama (adapted from Chuck Palahniuk's novel). Norton plays a bored executive who meets Tyler Durden (Pitt) on a plane. This mysterious stranger introduces him to a world of ennui-alleviating physical pain: Fight Club, a secretive society where men vent their frustrations in bare-knuckle fighting in dingy basements. But as Norton becomes more involved, he starts to learn about the shadowy and subversive organisation behind it all... Also starring Helena Bonham Carter, Meat Loaf and Jared Leto(n)

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: Ultra-violent futuristic thriller about infantry trainees preparing to wipe out mankind's newest enemy: giant bugs from outer space(n)

programme.title: What's Eating Gilbert Grape
programme.desc: In spite of these responsibilities, the young man attempts to lead a normal existence, until he meets a woman passing through town and life becomes even more complicated. Based on the novel by Peter Hedges(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: When teen city-boy Ren moves to a small Midwest town, he's horrified to find dancing and rock music banned. With the prom months away, Ren sparks a rebellion among students to persuade the town's fire-and-brimstone preacher to revoke the crazy laws(n)

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: Peter La Fleur owns Average Joe's Gym, a scruffy establishment with a loyal clientele, while across the street Globo Gym, owned by White Goodman, is all glass and chrome and full of toned muscle. When La Fleur learns that he must pay the bank $50,000 in 30 days, Goodman is overjoyed: he can acquire his rival's building, knock it down and have the car park his gym's always needed. But La Fleur decides to set up a money-earning dodgeball tournament (a sport that consists of not being hit by balls hurled by the opposing team). And, of course, La Fleur's team of misfits end up in a face-off against Goodman's tough pros in the final. Rawson Marshall Thurber's debut feature is a mix of verbal and physical humour, and, if the outcome is never in doubt, both Vaughn and Stiller throw themselves into the venture with enjoyable gusto(n)

programme.title: Jaws 3
programme.desc: The sons of Sheriff Brody are working at a marine theme park in Florida, but are in piscatorial purgatory once more when a rogue Great White shark starts attacking the tourists. Action adventure originally released in 3D(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: The man-eating shark wants revenge on Brody's widow, pursuing her and her marine biologist son to the Bahamas(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: When teen city-boy Ren moves to a small Midwest town, he's horrified to find dancing and rock music banned. With the prom months away, Ren sparks a rebellion among students to persuade the town's fire-and-brimstone preacher to revoke the crazy laws(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Kevin Williamson, who scripted Scream and Scream 2 struck gold again with this fright-film directed by Jim Gillespie, this time set in a small fishing town. Four rich, spoilt teenagers (Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Geller, Ryan Phillippe and Freddie Prinze Jnr) enjoy a drunken Independence Day beach picnic but on the way home, knock down a pedestrian. Even though he's not dead, they dump him in the sea and flee. A year later, they're all back home and all receive the chilling message - 'I know what you did last summer...'(n)

programme.title: Red State
programme.desc: Kevin Smith steps his foot into horror territory with this politically tinged fright flick starring Michael Parks (From Dusk Till Dawn, Grindhouse) as a controversial Fred Phelps-ish reverend who brings his own brand of zealotry to a wayward group of teens. Smith directs from his own long-in-development script(n)

programme.title: The Big Hit
programme.desc: Kirk Wong directed this comedy actioner about mild-mannered, beleaguered hitman Melvin Smiley (Mark Wahlberg), who very much wants to be liked. However, the naive Mel is being taken advantage of by both his girlfriends and associates (who cheat him out of his bonuses). Mel and his "Odd Squad" -- Cisco (Lou Diamond Phillips), Crunch (Bokeem Woodbine), Vince (Antonio Sabato Jr.), and Gump (Robin Dunne) -- work for Paris (Avery Brooks), head of an international crime cartel and a contractor for hit jobs. Mel's mistress Chantel (Lela Rochon), who views him as a meal ticket, lives rent-free in his house, misspends his money, and is continually thinking of ways to get more from him. Her latest scheme is concocting tales about overdue mortgage and car payments, but she really wants the money to run away with her lover Sergio. Mel and his team head into a big shootout to waste some rival mobsters. One person kills the electricity; the others don night-vision goggles. Melvin handles most of the action, including shooting while bungee-bouncing near a staircase, finally making a spectacular bungee-exit from the top floors of the building just as it explodes in flames. A quick and easy weekend job backfires when their kidnap victim, a rich industrialist's teenage daughter Keiko Nishi (China Chow), turns out to be the godchild of their boss, crime czar Paris. When Cisco, mastermind of the plan, is summoned by Paris, he manages to shift blame to Mel. Meanwhile, Chantel absconds with Mel's earnings just as the disapproving parents (Elliott Gould, Lainie Kazan) of Mel's fiancee Pam (Christina Applegate) are due for a visit. Since Pam gave her parents $50,000 from Mel's bank account, they're on their way to thank him and hopefully benefit from another financial windfall. As his professional and domestic woes collide, Mel finds himself dodging bullets while trying to impress his potential in-laws. Throw in an overzealous video-store clerk demanding the return of an overdue tape (King Kong Returns), and it's not long before Mel's life starts to unravel(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: Director Gore Verbinski and the crew set sail once again for this, the third chapter in the swashbuckling Pirates of the Caribbean trilogy. Captain Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp) is hopelessly trapped in Davy Jones' locker after a harrowing encounter with the dreaded Kracken, and now Will Turner (Orlando Bloom) and Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley) must align themselves with the nefarious Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) if they hold out any hope of saving their old friend from a fate worse than death. The East India Trading Company and its fearsome leader, Lord Cutler Beckett (Tom Hollander), have taken control of the ghostly Flying Dutchman and its captain, Davy Jones (Bill Nighy), and now the baleful Admiral Norrington (Jack Davenport) has taken the helm in a relentless bid to destroy every pirate ship in his path and bring the Age of Piracy to a violent close. Meanwhile, Will, Elizabeth, and Captain Barbossa navigate treacherous waters and face bitter betrayal as they set sail to gather the only army that can stand up to Beckett -- The Nine Lords of the Brethren Court. But Captain Jack Sparrow is one of the lords, and as long as he's stuck in Davy Jones' locker, Beckett and his nefarious armada are sure to emerge victorious. There's still hope, however, if the heroic team that includes Tia Dalma (Naomie Harris), Pintel (Lee Arenberg), and Ragetti (Mackenzie Crook) can reach exotic Singapore and convince vulpine pirate Sao Feng (Chow Yun-Fat) to provide them with charts and a ship. But even the powerful Brethren Court may need a bit of help from volatile sea goddess Calypso in order to weather the coming storm. With the entire future of the pirate way at stake, everyone will be forced to choose sides while drifting precariously to the edge of the earth for one final, spectacular battle(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: When aliens mistake images of 1980s arcade games as a sign of aggression, they attack Earth with evil versions of Pac-Man, Donkey Kong and other video-game characters. In response, the US president asks his old gamer pals to battle the invaders(n)

programme.title: Highlander: The Final Dimension
programme.desc: The third episode in the Highlander saga, this film describes the ongoing contest between immortals that began in Scotland 400 years ago. When the evil Kane breaks out of his tomb, he begins a bloody, super-powered search for good warrior Connor(n)

programme.title: 88 Minutes
programme.desc: College professor Jack Gramm races to prove a man he testified against deserves to be on Death Row, saving his own life in the process(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: Director Gore Verbinski and the crew set sail once again for this, the third chapter in the swashbuckling Pirates of the Caribbean trilogy. Captain Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp) is hopelessly trapped in Davy Jones' locker after a harrowing encounter with the dreaded Kracken, and now Will Turner (Orlando Bloom) and Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley) must align themselves with the nefarious Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) if they hold out any hope of saving their old friend from a fate worse than death. The East India Trading Company and its fearsome leader, Lord Cutler Beckett (Tom Hollander), have taken control of the ghostly Flying Dutchman and its captain, Davy Jones (Bill Nighy), and now the baleful Admiral Norrington (Jack Davenport) has taken the helm in a relentless bid to destroy every pirate ship in his path and bring the Age of Piracy to a violent close. Meanwhile, Will, Elizabeth, and Captain Barbossa navigate treacherous waters and face bitter betrayal as they set sail to gather the only army that can stand up to Beckett -- The Nine Lords of the Brethren Court. But Captain Jack Sparrow is one of the lords, and as long as he's stuck in Davy Jones' locker, Beckett and his nefarious armada are sure to emerge victorious. There's still hope, however, if the heroic team that includes Tia Dalma (Naomie Harris), Pintel (Lee Arenberg), and Ragetti (Mackenzie Crook) can reach exotic Singapore and convince vulpine pirate Sao Feng (Chow Yun-Fat) to provide them with charts and a ship. But even the powerful Brethren Court may need a bit of help from volatile sea goddess Calypso in order to weather the coming storm. With the entire future of the pirate way at stake, everyone will be forced to choose sides while drifting precariously to the edge of the earth for one final, spectacular battle(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: A former biker and drug dealer single-handedly takes on the nefarious Lord's Resistance Army in a noble bid to save young Sudanese refugees from a life of violence and suffering. Inspired by actual events, Marc Forster's Machine Gun Preacher stars Gerard Butler as Sam Childers, a tough-as-nails biker whose heart shatters upon witnessing the harrowing plight of children in Sudan. Determined that no child shall be enslaved by the brutal Lord's Resistance Army, Childers turns to God for inspiration, and establishes an orphanage for wounded kids and child soldiers. When the Lord's Resistance Army refuses to stand down, Childers organizes a militia to protect the children. In helping to give the orphans of war-torn Sudan a better future, the former outlaw begins to find new meaning in his own life as well(n)

programme.desc: A 23rd-century New York City cabbie encounters a genetically engineered alien named Leeloo, who has the life force that can unite the planet's elements and stave off a raging fireball that's on a collision course with Earth(n)

programme.title: On the Edge
programme.desc: A teenager finds himself reaching out to others as he tries to heal his emotional wounds in this drama. Jonathan (Cillian Murphy) is a young man who is having a difficult time coming to terms with the recent death of his father; after falling into a deep depression, he attempts to commit suicide by driving a car off an embankment. Jonathan survives the accident and is sent to a mental institution for treatment. While in the hospital, Jonathan becomes friendly with a disturbed youngster named Toby (Jonathan Jackson), and falls in love with Rachel (Tricia Vessey), another patient at the facility. Also featuring Stephen Rea, On the Edge was the third feature from Irish director John Carney and the first to be backed by a major American studio(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: A wealthy former classmate enlists Adrian's help to catch the intruders who broke into her home to deface a portrait - and unwittingly caused the death of her housekeeper in the process. Flashbacks reveal how the detective acquired many of his characteristic tics and catchphrases. Comedy drama, starring Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The team goes in search of a missing child who could prove to be an invaluable witness in the detectives' long-standing attempt to bring billionaire businessman Tommy Volker to justice. A henchmen who is thought to know the youngster's whereabouts is brought in for questioning, but refuses to talk and later takes his own life, fearful of the repercussions that await him. Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the team investigate the discovery of three corpses in a barn that appear to have been there for more than 20 years - and Jane is distressed when he finds Red John's trademark smiley face daubed on one of the walls. A ring from the scene is traced to a man who went missing in 1987 and was a member of the Visualize cult run by Jane's old enemy Bret Stiles.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Jane investigate when the body of a missing research student is discovered in a tank of flesh-eating insects at a natural history museum. The pair believe the woman was murdered by one of her fellow academics following her pioneering discovery of a new moth species - an accolade they suspect the culprit wanted to claim as their own. Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon, Jane and the team investigate when a rich, elderly woman's charred remains are found on the floor of a room in her mansion. They find the list of suspects is quite lengthy, including a nephew who was suing her in order to take control of the family fortune, a doctor who was overprescribing her pain medication and an alcoholic acquaintance at a war veteran's home. Jane, though, has a feeling that something about this case hasn't been right from the start.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.sub-title: Till Death Do Us Part - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. A high-profile divorce attorney is found dead in his swimming pool, and Brenda uncovers a secret that makes her think twice about moving forward with Fritz. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.sub-title: Till Death Do Us Part - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Brenda has 48 hours to get her case back on track after Jonathan Shafer's alibi comes to light. Meanwhile, the future of her relationship with Fritz seems uncertain when he reveals a secret from his past.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brenda tries to track down a witness in Atlanta, and takes the opportunity to visit home. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Part two of two. Brenda is forced to be creative when her witness remains hesitant, while the stress starts to get to Fritz. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and Jon Tenney.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A covert identity created for one of Gibbs' undercover cases 20 years previously resurfaces after a murder victim is found to be using the alias. Meanwhile, Bishop becomes anxious at the thought of having to work incognito in the future. Starring Mark Harmon and Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy lieutenant is murdered at the Defence Logistics Agency, while visitings the office of an admiral currently away at sea. As the team investigates the scene of the crime, they realise a rare painting found in the admiral's office is actually an elaborate fake placed there after the killing, replacing the stolen original. As the quest to locate the missing artwork gets under way, the agents realise they need the help of an expert. Luckily, Tony's con-artist father has returned to town, having broken up with his fiancee, and is on hand to provide expert advice as the hunt for the killer takes them into the shady world of the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is murdered at the home of Gunnery Sergeant Holt Perkins, and while the victim is initially assumed to be the marine's wife, analysis reveals her to be a convicted thief, presumed to be on the scene as part of a plot to hit Perkins' house. When the agents discover the calling card of notorious terror cell Dragon's Tooth on the body, it becomes clear the murder has been committed as part of a wider agenda, and the team joins forces with the Department of Defence to catch the killer. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A prostitute and what seems to be one of her clients are gunned down in a drive-by shooting, and when it emerges that the would-be John was actually a Navy officer, Gibbs and DiNozzo realise the killings are connected Lex Tarlionas, an incomplete operation to bring justice to those responsible for an attack on a US airport in 1979, which left 100 people dead. The main suspect is a former Colombian drugs kingpin known as Tomas Orlando, and the murdered sex worker was about to hand over crucial DNA evidence that could have connected him to the crime, but now that she is dead, Gibbs and the others must find another way to finally bring Orlando in. American drama, starring Mark Harmon and David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Peter go out on a mission to find a new Thanksgiving turkey after they drunkenly consume the whole bird the night before the holiday. Meanwhile, Chris decides to become the man of the house while his father is away.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Joe takes revenge on Brian for kissing Bonnie, while Chris and Meg are caught stealing from the residents of a retirement community.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve and his pals turn to witchcraft in a bid to gain popularity at school. Meanwhile, Stan and Klaus become obsessed with reminiscing about bands from the 1990s.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers his first name is actually Justin while creating a checking account, and takes on the new moniker to create a younger, hipper alter-ego. The father then holds a party, where Quagmire unwittingly gets into trouble with his own mother.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois fulfils a lifelong ambition by becoming a model, much to the displeasure of Peter and her father. Meanwhile, Brian works for Stewie's marketing company to pay for the treatment of an embarrassing problem.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Griffins become millionaires after Peter blows his life savings on lottery tickets, but things take a turn for the worse as they struggle to cope with their new-found wealth. Comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: Decker: Unsealed
programme.desc: New series. Tim Heidecker's comedy creation returns, as President Davidson Jr recounts more of Agent Jack Decker patriotic exploits to the operative's son, Jack Decker Jr.(n)

programme.title: Decker: Unsealed
programme.desc: President Davidson Jr shares another of Special Agent Jack Decker's heroic exploits with the fearless agent's son, Jack Decker Jr. Comedy, starring Tim Heidecker.(n)

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Rick and Summer throw an intergalactic house party, while Beth and Jerry go on a romantic getaway.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: Don't Look a Smith Horse in the Mouth.
programme.desc: Francine demands that Stan gives up his expensive SUV, so he buys a racehorse in a bid to win enough money to keep his petrol-guzzling car. Meanwhile, Steve enlists the aid of his friends to help an old acquaintance. Comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Wendy Schaal.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan complains that liberal social programmes are a waste of money and criticises Francine for helping at the local homeless shelter - until he develops a crack cocaine addiction and suddenly has a change of heart.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine decides to drop her beauty regimen ahead of her 20th wedding anniversary, hoping to determine whether Stan loves her for more than her looks. However, the spy becomes upset that his wife has started to let herself go, and resorts to drastic measures when she asks him to renew their marital vows.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Hayley goes to a concert by My Morning Jacket against Stan's orders, so he attends the show and demands she return home - only for him to become obsessed with the band and to follow them as a groupie.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: 8 Simple Rules for Buying My Teenage Daughter.
programme.desc: Peter runs up a massive bill at the pharmacy and decides to sell Meg to the Goldmans to help pay it off - much to their son Neil's delight. However, she becomes jealous when he starts dating someone else. Meanwhile, Stewie falls in love with his new babysitter.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Breaking Out Is Hard to Do.
programme.desc: Lois is sent to prison for persistent shoplifting, plunging the family into such disarray that Peter feels obliged to help her escape. Forced to go on the run, they take refuge in `Asian Town' - where Joe eventually tracks them down.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan tries to show Hayley that he can still provide relevant advice by resolving to improve the life of a stripper. However, his hopes of proving his headstrong daughter wrong are dashed when his circumstances change for the worse, and he ends up dancing for cash at his own strip club.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The world ends on Christmas Day, and the entire population of Earth is taken to Heaven - except for Stan and Francine, who get left behind and find themselves involved in an all-out war against the Antichrist.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Secret Santa.
programme.desc: With Natalie tagging along in the guise of an elf, Adrian goes to work as a department store Santa in a bid to catch a fugitive suspected of poisoning a police officer. Unfortunately, seasonal jollity is not his forte. Detective drama, starring Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Jane investigate when the body of a missing research student is discovered in a tank of flesh-eating insects at a natural history museum. The pair believe the woman was murdered by one of her fellow academics following her pioneering discovery of a new moth species - an accolade they suspect the culprit wanted to claim as their own. Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon, Jane and the team investigate when a rich, elderly woman's charred remains are found on the floor of a room in her mansion. They find the list of suspects is quite lengthy, including a nephew who was suing her in order to take control of the family fortune, a doctor who was overprescribing her pain medication and an alcoholic acquaintance at a war veteran's home. Jane, though, has a feeling that something about this case hasn't been right from the start.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lorelei Martins returns to avenge the death of her sister, convinced she has identified at least one of those responsible. She lies in wait at the home of a staff member of a shelter for battered women, eventually handcuffing her victim to a table and dispensing some savage justice. Thanks to the presence of a security camera, the team is soon after her, while Jane tries to exploit the situation to catch a bigger fish - Red John.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Jane investigate the murder of Corporal Lucy Green, who was a medic in an army hospital and spent a lot of time helping veterans who had post-traumatic stress disorder. Jane figures out a patient named Jacob made the emergency call, but he is suffering from severe amnesia and does not remember anything about that evening. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: When a murderer recently released from prison is killed in a hit-and-run, the team tries to determine whether the incident was intentional or a coincidence. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo teams up with his girlfriend, ATF agent Zoe Keates, to investigate the circumstances surrounding the death of a US Marine in what initially seems like a simple road accident. The team reveals the dead man did indeed die due to a broken neck sustained during a crash, but someone shot at him first. As DiNozzo and Keates pursue their inquiry, they discover the victim's death is connected to a controversial ATF plan to place traceable firearms in the criminal system, and then follow them to the heads of crime organisations. Naval crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine visits the home of his former captain, only to find the man has been killed, and the killer is waiting inside the property. While the soldier escapes with his life, the attacker gets away too. It quickly emerges the prime suspect is Qasim, an Afghan translator evidence, and evidence points against him, until it is discovered he has a brother, who is loyal to the Taliban. The subsequent chain of evidence leads Gibbs and Bishop to Afghanistan.(n)

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: An itinerant ex-military investigator is tasked with solving a shooting spree that isn't quite as cut-and-dry as it first seems as author Lee Child's 2005 novel One Shot comes to the big screen courtesy of writer/director Christopher McQuarrie. When a crazed sniper guns down five seemingly random people on a crowded Pittsburgh riverfront, Det. Emerson (David Oyelowo) quickly amasses enough evidence at the scene to implicate an unstable ex-military sniper named James Barr (Joseph Sikora). Upon being questioned by Emerson and DA Alex Rodin (Richard Jenkins), however, Barr demands to speak with Jack Reacher (Tom Cruise). A former military investigator who fell off the grid following his service, Reacher soon shows up on the scene and begins gathering clues with the aid of talented defense attorney Helen Rodin (Rosamund Pike), the daughter of the DA. Meanwhile, when Reacher is assaulted in a local bar, he correctly surmises that someone is determined to impede his investigation. His theory plays out when he becomes the prime suspect in the murder of a young woman shortly thereafter. Now, with the police closing in from one side and a gang of ruthless killers gaining ground on the other, Reacher must use his formidable detective skills in order to catch the gunman and uncover his true motives(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: They Saved Lisa's Brain. While Springfield has never been known as a hub of high culture, things hit a new low when local radio station KBBL sponsors a "How Low Can You Go?" Contest, in which the entrant who performs the most humiliating stunt in public wins a trip to Hawaii. A melee ensues, and a disgusted Lisa Simpson (voice of Yeardley Smith) writes a letter to the editor of the Springfield Shopper, proclaiming "we live in a town of lowbrows, no-brows and ignorami." The letter attracts the attention of Springfield's chapter of MENSA, the international organization for people of genius-level IQ, and Lisa is invited to join. When the MENSA members pay a visit to Mayor Quimby (voice of Dan Castellaneta) to complain about the police's handling of park reservations, the wildly corrupt elected official thinks they've uncovered his misdeeds and he his the road. Under a little-known provision in the city charter, the MENSA team takes over the city government in Quimby's absence, but just because they're brilliant doesn't mean they're able to agree on things. Meanwhile, Homer (also voiced by Castellaneta) wins a session with a boudoir photographer, and tries to come up with some spicy snaps for his wife Marge (voice of Julie Kavner), even though the shutterbug warns him "light is not your friend." Featuring a voice cameo from actual genius Stephen Hawking, "They Saved Lisa's Brain" first aired on May 9, 1999(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.sub-title: Queens NY: World's Best Food Town.
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern gets a global food experience without ever leaving New York City when he visits the borough of Queens.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert Irvine helps Bryant's Seafood World, which has been a local institution in Hueytown, Alabama, for over 30 years, but is now floundering under the new owner's four year reign.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The co-owner of German restaurant Speiskammer, Alameda, worries that his staff hired by her ex-husband could be more trouble than they are worth.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Bistro Baffi asks Charles Stiles and the team to help when several expensive bottles of wine go missing from his restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares more tempting recipes, including lamb kebabs, tomato feta salad and angel food cake.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Loin of pork with fennel stuffing, cauliflower gratin and a pumpkin parfait with ginger biscuits.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef Ina Garten prepares crunchy noodle salad, Asian grilled salmon and lemon yoghurt cake.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten cooks a wild mushroom lasagne and a simplified shrimp bisque.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: It's hot and spicy at Chilli Fest, and Anna Olson has to decide who makes it to the US competition.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna Olson has a group of chefs for dinner, so she makes brioche toast with brandied mushrooms in cream, braised beef short ribs over mustard seed spaetzle, and citrus red cabbage.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: On the road and cooking with a ladies-only motorcycle club, Ezra and Julie rev up the flavours while still delivering a healthy meal for the discerning bikers.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks for her family reunion, a camp out down by the creek, by making preparations for cheesy bacon hot dogs and campfire quesadillas over the fire.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares some great ideas for simple, minimal-prep dorm room food made with basic tools.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is stocking the fridge with some make-ahead dishes for a cocktail party.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond celebrates her and her husband's anniversary by preparing a Colorado wedge salad, prime rib for five with chimichurri, and rustic country bread with honey butter.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four cake artists create emoji-themed cakes, with Gedeon Maheux, co-founder of Iconfactory, on hand to judge their creations.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: When Haylie gets a call from her agent saying PopSugar wants to do a segment on healthy Asian-inspired recipes, she and Alanna Masterson learn about Asian cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: While peddling to create their own salted caramel ice cream at Peddler's Creamery, Haylie and Kurt challenge each other to a sandwich cooking competition and a softball game.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver uses wild mushrooms picked in his local forest to rustle up simple dishes including risotto, bruschetta and a venison and funghi stroganoff. His mentor Gennaro Contaldo explains the dangers of some varieties, before sampling the recipes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver joins a partridge shoot, finding out from a gamekeeper how to get involved with the countryside. He then rustles up dishes using fresh game birds and recipes inspired by Asian, European and traditional British cuisine, designed to get the best flavour possible.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mary Ann Gilchrist, David Kelman and Andy Beaumont go all out to impress with their desserts in their attempts to secure a place to represent Wales at a banquet in St Paul's Cathedral marking the 70th anniversary of D-Day. The mystery Great British Menu veteran then decides which of the trio will not be returning for the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from Wales prepare their entire menus for Prue Leith, Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and guest judge and former war correspondent Martin Bell. Only one contender can make it through to the national finals and get the chance to cook at a banquet held in St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of the Normandy landings.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares chicken nachos two-ways for the family to eat after the homecoming parade. Then she's off to her boys' football game armed with chocolate chunk cookies.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Stacking the Hay and Stocking the Freezer.
programme.desc: While the family stacks hay, Ree Drummond stocks up the freezer with dishes including chicken enchiladas, pizza pockets, three cheese stuffed shells, and purple smoothie popsicles.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four cake artists compete to have their creations at the centre of a birthday party celebrating The Garfield Show.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: The junior chefs encounter pigs' ears and potatoes as they strive to impress chefs Katie Lee and Chris Santos and actor Alan Thicke.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Burnside Brewing Company, a brewery known for its perfect pairings of home-made beers and delicious bar food.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits the country music capital of the world and learns about Pepperfire, a restaurant that makes Nashville-style hot chicken.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef looks for things to do with pumpkins other than turning them into traditional Halloween lanterns. Recipes include a roast duck and pumpkin winter salad with Asian dressing, a soup and a lighter snack - squash fairy cakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves up home-grown winter salad dishes, including a bagna cauda, a herb omelette, and a Japanese-style tuna sashimi with sprouting herb salad and a surprising dressing. Meanwhile, gardener Brian experiments with seeds to demonstrate the full array of colourful, tasty ingredients available in the cold, dark months.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger visits two legendary barbecue joints in Central Texas, where just the right amount of smoke and heat transforms the meat into delicious eats.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger takes a trip to West Point, Texas, to meet Tink Pinkard. Together they build a barbecue pit out of cinder blocks and prepare Italian porchetta.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty present dishes for the weekend from their cafe on Southend Pier, joined by celebrity guests in the kitchen. The duo also tour Britain to promote some of the nation's best regional foods, from Lancashire's Tosset cake to Colchester pudding. In this edition, Olympic sprinting champion Usain Bolt cooks his Aunt Lily's jerk pork, Jamie prepares the ultimate steak and Jimmy makes a tandoor oven out of a dustbin and a flowerpot.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Husband and wife Larry and Joan own The Original Mama Angelo's, a family-style Italian eatery, but they need Willie to pull Mama Angelo's back from the brink of disaster.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When Angie, the owner of Cha Cha Cha Salsaria in Honolulu, hears rumours of an unauthorised boat delivery service, she contacts Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners go undercover to discover what's taking place out at sea.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After hearing complaints about non-members attending members-only events, the general manager of Hawaii Yacht Club calls Charles Stiles for help. Mystery Diners go undercover to discover which employees are sneaking in friends.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: While abroad on a business trip, Rex plays a joke on Martin placing him in a compromising position as he awakens and making him fear he has been unfaithful to Anne. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: In the process of standing accused of a series of murders, it seems Gordon has actually foiled an international drugs ring. Comedy, with Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will Howard Cross the Atlantic Single-Handed?.
programme.desc: Hobbo is convinced Nelly is his natural mother and tries to establish where he was born, while Howard vows to row across the Atlantic single-handed in a bid to counter Marina's suggestions that he lacks spontaneity. Barry's clothing problem is solved when he is called to help clear Toby's blocked drain.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Looking Sideways at Nelly?.
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists the help of Aunty Wainwright to become a master of disguise and deceive his secret enemies, and is delighted when Marina is attracted to his new looks - to the great annoyance of Howard. Meanwhile, a misunderstanding over a neck injury puts the police on Alvin and Entwistle's trail.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Nobody Messes with Tony the Throat.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey moves out of Grantleigh Manor, and Richard and his mother move in, disappointing the former resident with their new ways. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.(n)

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: The return of the comedy set in a chaotic household, written by and starring Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer. Bob feels that his 23-year-old son Erik has come of age and decides to arrange a surprise blind date for him at Julie's bistro with a woman Beef found on the internet. However, Erik has problems selecting an appropriate outfit, while Vic and Bob fall out over their band's debut gig, which is also due to take place at the restaurant that night. With Matt Berry, Daniel Simonsen and Ellie White.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Grand Theatre in Swansea, South Wales. Sean Lock heads the showcase of stand-ups from the comedy circuit, with support from Steve Williams, Ava Vidal and Alun Cochrane.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Dermot's pre-marriage nerves get the better of him and he locks himself away in a cupboard, so it is up to Agnes, Father Quinn and best man Buster to try to calm him down. Meanwhile, Rory's secret is revealed to his mother. Bawdy comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Paddy Houlihan.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The boys join Mrs Lineker's Love Bureau hoping to find their perfect love matches. Richie's video tells the potential suitors that he is, in fact, a duke and this secures him a date with a countess from Moldavia. Undeterred, he invites her to his place and arranges for Eddie to pretend to be his butler for the evening. Chaotic comedy, written by and starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Grand Theatre in Swansea, South Wales. Sean Lock heads the showcase of stand-ups from the comedy circuit, with support from Steve Williams, Ava Vidal and Alun Cochrane.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Miss Postern is given the task of running the draughts club and suggests merging with Mr Church's chess fanatics, so he invites her to his place to discuss the idea - but soon regrets his first attempt at social networking. Meanwhile, Mr Gunn is spotted with a drug dealer and a scandal looms, but who is the addict? Classroom comedy, starring David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister.(n)

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Holiday antics with 1970s pop group Slade on a camping trip, and a special edition of MasterChef. Plus, the Bra Men take a walk around an art gallery and Bob gets stuck in a glass jar.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Sir Norman Fry is forced to explain an embarrassing incident with a glace cherry in Little Fumble. Vicky Pollard proves hopelessly inept in her new career as a babysitter and Mr Mann tries on an unusual costume at the fancy-dress shop. Comedy sketches, guest starring comedian and writer David Baddiel and Big Top's Ruth Madoc.(n)

programme.title: The Armando Iannucci Shows
programme.desc: Armando tackles the subject of communication through sketches involving a middle-aged couple in a restaurant who don't speak to each other, and a man doing DIY who accidentally nails himself to a cabinet but is too embarrassed to tell his wife.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that the UK has to offer. He rustles up an impressive range of dishes, using the finest seasonal produce.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris help Clare and Richard from Hatfield, Hertfordshire, who are so busy with work and looking after two young children they have found themselves stuck in a rather unusual rut - seven years ago they devised a weekly meal plan - Monday is pizza, Wednesday is spaghetti bolognese and so on - and it hasn't changed since. Not only this, but they always buy big brands and premium supermarket ranges, which is an expensive way to shop for what has become a boring way to eat. Gregg and Chris are determined to help them - but breaking the family's habits isn't going to be easy.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the first quarter-final, in which the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from a selection of ingredients including poussin, squid, mango and dark chocolate. After a double elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Tracey MacLeod, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers meet three keen cooks from Northern Ireland who take inspiration from international cuisine. The duo sample paella and Catalan tomato bread, a chicken curry with handmade roti bread, and an Argentinean recipe using partridge. The bikers also prepare their version of haddock mornay and Gerard Baker organises another cookery challenge.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Cooking
programme.desc: The food writer provides everyday cooking advice, demonstrating recipes that are uncomplicated and easy to remember. In the first edition, he prepares five sweet and sour dishes, including pork chops with gooseberry and rhubarb with caramel sauce, before meeting two friends who make oriental lemongrass and sea bass parcels served with a pineapple dip.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Vietnam
programme.desc: The chef visits historic Hue, where he prepares the local delicacy lemongrass skewers.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John discovers the importance of soup in Korea, goes to Noodle Alley in Seoul to have a go at hand-cutting noodles, and makes a marinated beef stew.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: The Guests from Loughborough eat a diet of convenience food that is not only unwholesome, it is also very expensive. Mum Lisa is aware she has to make her family more healthy, but is going about it the wrong way, buying into costly `superfoods' rather than good old-fashioned fruit and veg. Can Gregg and Chris help the Guests bring more variety to their plates - and in turn, knock a whopping 50 per cent off their shopping bill? Along the way, they also investigate how canned fish compares to fresh and which oil is best for cooking, as well as the diet cons to watch out for.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six new cooks take on two challenges. The first three begin with a Skills Test set by Marcus Wareing. They have 15 minutes to make a Buck Rarebit - a Welsh Rarebit with a fried egg on top. The remaining three contestants must complete a Skills Test set by Monica Galetti, who examines their butchery skills by asking them to joint a whole rabbit and prepare it for cooking. In the final challenge the six chefs cook their own Signature Dish, before the best three are put through to the quarter finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers meet three keen cooks who demonstrate recipes for high tea. Farmer's wife Polly cooks beef and honey stew, and lamb and mint sausages, while Nancy Davis shares a transatlantic take on tea with her mother's meatloaf dish and potato salad. Lisa Hobson enlists the bikers' help to uncover the mysteries of a family recipe book, and the duo prepare savoury pies and a lemon curd Swiss roll.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Cooking
programme.desc: The food writer turns his attention to surf and turf meals - fish combined with meat - demonstrating how to prepare classic recipes that are uncomplicated and easy to remember. He makes dishes including trout with Parma ham and lamb shanks with anchovies, before learning how a fisherman keeps his crew happy by cooking scallops with chorizo.(n)

programme.desc: Luke visits the small town of Vinh, where he explores the vibrant market lifestyle and local food.(n)
